//notes: the nylon catcher part is not technically rigid, but it's shaped enough by the metal skeleton to effectively retain its shape throughout the filling process
description: A nylon bag that could be strapped to a gun in order to retain "brass", i.e. casings from fired rounds.

variants.description: A large nylon bag for collecting shot casings.  Mounts onto any long gun by strapping onto it with hook-and-loop retainers.  <variant:black>

notes: a review on MidwayUSA says the opening (the window through which spent cases drop into the bag) is about 2.5 in. × 6 in.
from these dimensions, we can assume the length of the entire catcher is 6 in.
we can also assume that height is 2 × 2.5 in. = 5 in.
width/depth seems to be smaller than the height of the opening, about 2 in.
we add another 0.25 in. to width to account for the hinge and the straps

//max_contains_volume: this catcher is rated for 100 .223/5.56mm casings
visually, it seems as though only 45% of the catcher's overall capacity is devoted to the casings
this would prevent new casings from overflowing back towards the bolt, potentially jamming the gun

description: A cotton bag hanging off the side of your gun, catching ejected casings until it's full.  It should help you if you're planning on handloading ammunition.  Also, it prevents pollution (even though the world has ended).
//volume: 47 ml from cotton sheet + 5 ml for extras, like attachment straps
